investment.portfolio

Class Portfolio

  • java.lang.Object
    • investment.portfolio.Portfolio

  • public class Portfolio
extends java.lang.Object
    Class to manage set of investments of Stocks and Mutual Funds

    • Method Detail

      • getInvestmentList

        public java.util.ArrayList<Investment> getInvestmentList()
        Returns a copy of the investment array list
        Returns:
        the copy of investment array list

      • setInvestmentList

        public void setInvestmentList(java.util.ArrayList<Investment> investmentList)
        Sets the investment array list
        Parameters:
        investmentList - the new investment array list

      • buyInvestment

        public int buyInvestment(int type,
                         java.lang.String symbol,
                         java.lang.String name,
                         int quantity,
                         double price,
                         javax.swing.JTextArea outputArea)
        Buy a new investment or more of an existing based on the given attributes
        Parameters:
        type - the type of investment, stock or mutual fund
        symbol - the symbol of the investment
        name - the name for the investment
        quantity - the number of shares/units to buy
        price - the buy price for each share/unit
        outputArea - text area where user messages should be displayed
        Returns:
        static constant Application.SUCCESS if purchase was successful

      • sellInvestment

        public int sellInvestment(java.lang.String symbol,
                          int amount,
                          double price,
                          javax.swing.JTextArea outputArea)
        Sell an investment that matches the given symbol
        Parameters:
        symbol - the symbol of the investment
        amount - the number of shares/units to sell
        price - the sell price for each share/unit
        outputArea - text area where messages are displayed
        Returns:
        static constant Application.SUCESS if selling was successful, otherwise one of the static constants from the Application class corresponding to an error

      • getGain

        public double getGain(javax.swing.JTextArea outputArea)
        Calculates the total accumulated gain of all Stocks and Mutual Funds in the Portfolio
        Parameters:
        outputArea - text area where individual gains for each investment are displayed
        Returns:
        the total accumulated gain

      • updatePrice

        public int updatePrice(java.lang.String symbol,
                       double price)
        Used to update the prices for all investments in the portfolio, one-by-one
        Parameters:
        symbol - the symbol of investment to update
        price - the new price for the symbol
        Returns:
        Application.SUCCESS if there were no errors, or Application.ERROR_EMPTY_PORTFOLIO if portfolio contains no investments

      • search

        public void search(java.lang.String symbol,
                   java.lang.String[] keywords,
                   double minPrice,
                   double maxPrice,
                   javax.swing.JTextArea outputArea)
        Displays the details of all investments that match a given search criteria
        Parameters:
        symbol - the symbol to match
        keywords - the word-level keywords to match in the investment name
        minPrice - the investment price must be greater than this value
        maxPrice - the investment price must be lower than this value
        outputArea - text area where results of output will be displayed

      • isEmpty

        public boolean isEmpty()
        Checks if there are any active investments in the portfolio
        Returns:
        true if portfolio is empty, false otherwise

      • savePortfolio

        public void savePortfolio(java.lang.String filepath)
        Saves all investments to external file

      • loadPortfolio

        public void loadPortfolio(java.lang.String filepath)
        Loads investment data from external file
